format_1_state_log.event_description: Mrs. Vance was admitted to Highland Manor post-COPD exacerbation, but the PN was not assigned until Day 14 due to a system integration error between Atlantis and DocNow.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: The 'Black Hole' delay resulted in the family already selecting a sub-par HHA recommended by a neighbor before the PN could provide a vetted list.

format_1_state_log.event_description: The region's only Pulmonologist, Dr. Aris, contracted a severe flu, preventing the final 'face-to-face' O2 titration required for home oxygen certification.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: Provider Illness; the SNF Social Worker, Janet, refuses to seek a cross-coverage order from the Medical Director due to fear of 'stepping on toes' and her own burnout-induced apathy.

format_1_state_log.event_description: Facility administration issues a hard notice that Medicare Part A benefits will exhaust on Day 100, regardless of the Pulmonologist's availability.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: The 100-Day Cliff; the facility is prioritizing bed turnover over clinical stability to avoid the financial burden of a non-skilled resident.

format_2_triples.situation: Initial PN assignment occurred on Day 14 of the SNF stay, creating a trust gap with the family.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Shadowed the SNF wound nurse during afternoon rounds to gain facility entry and meet the patient in-person immediately.
format_2_triples.intent: Gain trust and prepare patient for transition

format_2_triples.situation: Pulmonologist illness caused a gap in the Managed Medicare face-to-face documentation for home O2.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Reviewed clinical notes in DocNow to ensure the NP's previous 'round notes' contained sufficient respiratory assessment data to support an appeal.
format_2_triples.intent: Maintain relationship for early discharge info

format_2_triples.situation: Social Worker Janet is unresponsive to emails regarding the HHA selection for the 100-day discharge.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Coordinated with the Regional Director to confirm the HHA's first appointment availability to prevent 'Double Dipping' on the Day 100 exit.
format_2_triples.intent: Ensure service payment and coverage safety

format_3_rl_scenario.description: The PN identifies that Dr. Aris's illness will delay the O2 order past the 100-day cliff. They facilitate a three-way call between the SNF Medical Director, the HHA clinical lead, and the Managed Medicare case manager to secure a one-time authorization for a 'bridge' generalist order based on previous hospital records.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This respects the professional hierarchy by involving the Medical Director for clinical sign-off while proactively addressing the bureaucratic Managed Medicare Auth requirement to prevent a care gap.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: Seeing the Social Worker's lack of initiative, the PN contacts Dr. Aris's personal cell phone via a contact at another facility to demand a verbal order for O2, then manually updates the patient's titration log in the facility's paper chart to reflect the 'new' verbal order.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: While highly proactive, this is a seductive overstep that violates medical staff bylaws, HIPAA boundaries regarding private contact info, and constitutes non-clinical personnel altering clinical documentation.

narrative_summary: Mrs. Evelyn Vance, a 71yo O2-dependent COPD patient, is trapped between a 100-day Medicare cliff and a provider availability crisis. A 14-day 'Black Hole' delay in PN assignment allowed a burned-out Social Worker to lose control of the discharge plan, while the only local Pulmonologist's illness stalled mandatory Managed Medicare face-to-face O2 documentation. The PN must navigate a hostile facility environment to secure a bridge of care before the hard financial stop on Day 100 forces a transition to private pay.
